CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1964, pg. 9 reads: "Granddaddy On The Job - When word reached J.C. Crunkleton Sr. about the exciting time at Rainbow Gardens, July 2 and 3, in McKeesport, he said, "Mrs. 'Happy' [Polk], I want my grandchildren to enjoy that outing." When told he could invite other children, he said, "Give me 10 six-month subscriptions."  he is pictured here distributing the Rainbow Gardens tickets to Anthony Crunkleton, 1 1/2; Stacy, 1 year; Karen Crunkleton, 4; Martina Kenderson, 7; Martin W. Kenderson Jr., 5; Priscilla Jeffrey, 7; Marlene Kenderson, 9; Diane Mason, 11, and Maurice Davidson, 10.  The grown-ups in picture are Jesse V. Crunkleton and John C. Crunkleton, sons and Mrs. J.V. Crunkleton and Mrs. J.C. Crunkleton, daughters- in-law.  The funeral home is located on Liverpool St.  Churches represented are Ebenezer Baptist, Allen Chapel AME and St. Joseph's Catholic. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: J.C. Crunkleton Sr., seated center, handing out Rainbow Garden tickets to grandchildren and their friends, with Mr. and Mrs. Jessie V. Crunkleton and Mr. and Mrs. John C. Crunkleton posed on left, gathered in J.G. Crunkleton Funeral Home, Liverpool Street
